bestBHT.bht: As Jesus stood before the soldiers, one of them took off His robe, possibly the same one Herod had mockingly placed on Him earlier. Then, they replaced it with a scarlet cloak, a symbol of mock royal attire. The scarlet robe, resembling the royal purple, was typically worn by soldiers, magistrates, kings, and emperors. This act of stripping Him of His clothes was not only a physical humiliation but also signified Him taking on the weight of our sins.

Henry Alford: 28.] Possibly the mantle in which He had been sent back from Herod—see note on Luke, ver. 11: or perhaps one of the ordinary soldiers’ cloaks.
Marvin Vincent: Robe [χλαμυδα] . The short military cloak which kings and emperors as well as soldiers wore.
Philip Schaff: His clothing was replaced after the scourging, and probably also the robe which Herod had put on Him to mock Him (Luke 23:11), usually supposed to have been white, marking Him as a candidate for royal honors.
This robe was removed, and instead they put on him a scarlet robe, the sign of His having attained royal honors.
Mark and John speak of it as ‘purple;’ but imperial or royal purple is more scarlet than blue.
Archibald T. Robertson: The scarlet colour (κοκκινην) was a dye derived from the female insect (κερμες) which gathered on the ιλεξ χοχχιφερα found in Palestine.
This scarlet mantle on Jesus was mock imitation of the royal purple.
The scarlet robe... a soldier's sagum or scarf... worn by soldiers, military officers, magistrates, kings, emperors.
John Gill: For one man to spit upon another, as these soldiers afterwards did on Christ, or to strip him of his garment, according to the Jewish canons, were punishable with a fine of four hundred pence
His clothes on his back seem to be all he had in this world, and of these he is stripped
This was an emblem of his being clothed, as it were with our sins, which are as scarlet, and of his bloody sufferings in the human nature
John Wesley: They put on him a scarlet robe — Such as kings and generals wore; probably an old tattered one.
